text: Hi all, is there a way to hide specific default module fields? For example, I'm using the default Menu module, but I'd like to hide the options for number of flyouts and orientation. Thanks!

1. You have to clone current menu module and delete field you don’t want
2. or else use menu filed in custom module
Hope this help
I expect to have more information on this today. Sorry for the delay

There a reason why this isn’t working in a module.html file?
```{% inline_rich_text field='html' value='{{ module.html }}' extra_classes='my-rt {{ module.settings.color_theme }}' %}```
:point_up_2::skin-tone-2: renders a classlist of `hs_cos_wrapper hs_cos_wrapper_widget hs_cos_wrapper_type_inline_rich_text my-rt {{ module.settings.color_theme }}`
when adding a module to a drag and drop area, how do you preset some of the styling available in the style tab?
What would be the easiest way to lazy load background images in HubSpot?
you could use an image tag with loading="lazy" and use object-fit instead of a css background image
<@U6MHBFW1K> Is there any updates yet. We are waiting for this to be resolved so that we can move ahead.

Anyone can help with the image non-display issue in this link? <https://www.realtimenetworks.com/industries/key-asset-management-solutions-law-enforcement> the problem is on this one:
<div class="ts-image-bkg bg-img lazy loaded" data-ll-status="loaded" style="background-image: url("<https://www.realtimenetworks.com/hubfs/KeyTracer-one-page/Key-Tracer_hero-banner2.jpg>");"></div>

Hi Mohit, I’ve confirmed that our auth system is successfully authing this request, generating a code, and redirecting to `<http://hs-app-auth.catapult.app|hs-app-auth.catapult.app>` , which is returning the “Forbidden” message
Do you own the hs-app-auth app?
Looks like the "transform" is causing the issue.

Thank you so much for your prompt reply. Yes, it is but how can I fix it? It is added as a style code in the HTML and I seem have no access to it in the source file. I am new to HubSpot so that I have no clue where to find that piece of code and delete it.

I can't really be of much help without being in the backend. I'm going to say this is probably being injected by the slider you are using and I'm not really sure why you are using a slider at this point.
It might be the right thing to do depending on what you are trying to do I just can't tell by looking at the website.
Are there any potential plans to allow modules to be placed within other modules?
